channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How HR leaders can talk employees through volatile economic times
item.description: There’s so many CEOs who think that we ought to do happy talk, or show optimism, or let people look on the bright side.”

item.title: Why Trump Could Lose His Trade War With China
item.description: The Times Opinion columnist discusses what he thinks Trump — and American policymakers — misunderstand about China in the escalating trade war.

item.title: OpenAI can’t afford to ignore Hollywood’s warning
item.description: OpenAI’s Hollywood misadventure is reminiscent of an earlier dispute between the media industry and Silicon Valley.

item.title: Trump’s latest crypto venture will be a real estate video game
item.description: The game, which some compared to Monopoly, is reportedly being developed by longtime Trump pal Bill Zanker.

item.title: Trump Administration Will Freeze $2 Billion After Harvard Refuses Demands
item.description: Federal officials said they would freeze the money after Harvard said it would not submit to requests to overhaul hiring and report international stud...

item.title: Head of Kuwait Specialty Field Hospital in Gaza Says Israeli Strike Killed a Guard
item.description: Israel’s military did not immediately comment on the report, which came two days after it attacked the Ahli Arab Hospital in Gaza City.

item.title: Does Blue Origin’s all-female spaceflight mean anything for women?
item.description: Six women came back from space "forever changed."

item.title: Sandstorm Turns Iraq’s Skies Orange and Sends Thousands to Hospitals
item.description: Climate experts say such storms are becoming more frequent and severe in the country. This was its worst of the year so far.

item.title: Apple could face a customer loyalty crisis if tariffs boost prices, says tech analyst
item.description: Customers in the U.S. are racing to buy iPhones before potential price increases.

item.title: Intense Sandstorm in Iraq Grounds Flights and Fills Emergency Rooms
item.description: A severe sandstorm swept central and southern Iraq, reducing visibility, halting flights and causing respiratory problems for thousands, according to ...

item.title: Stocks Edge Higher as Investors Assess Tariff Scenarios
item.description: The Trump administration’s chaotic tariff rollout continues to spur volatility in the markets.

item.title: Sandstorm Turns Iraq’s Skies Orange and Sends Thousands to Hospitals
item.description: Climate experts say such storms are becoming more frequent and severe in the country. This was its worst of the year so far.
